summary: This is an email chain between U.S. Attorney's Office personnel discussing financial compensation provided by Jeffrey Epstein to an employee referred to as 'M'. It details her salary, benefits, and large payments, including $100,000 for her wedding and a later $250,000 payment, highlighting her financial dependence on Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Described as the source of salary, housing, travel, clothing, food, and large monetary gifts (including $100,000 for a wedding) for an employee referred to as 'M'. He also paid for her attorney during a deposition.

connections.description: Epstein employed 'M', paying her a salary and providing extensive benefits including housing, travel, clothing, and food. He also gave her large monetary gifts.
Epstein was the sole source of income and financial support for 'M', who had no other income or family connections. He provided a $100,000 wedding gift and a later $250,000 payment.

events.title: Employee's Wedding and $100K Gift
events.description: The employee referred to as 'M' married her husband. Jeffrey Epstein gave her $100,000 in connection with the wedding, after which she left her job with him.

events.title: $250,000 Payment to Former Employee
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein made a payment of $250,000 to his former employee 'M', years after she had left his employment.

events.title: Epstein's Incarceration and Employee Pay Cut
events.description: When Jeffrey Epstein went to jail, the salary for his employee 'M' was reduced from over $100,000 to $75,000 per year.

events.title: Employee Deposition
events.description: The employee 'M' was deposed in a lawsuit. Jeffrey Epstein paid for her attorney for this legal proceeding.

keyFacts: An employee ('M') of Jeffrey Epstein was entirely financially dependent on him, with no other income sources, family connections (due to being 'disfellowshipped'), or friends outside his orbit.
Epstein provided his employee with a comprehensive compensation package including salary, housing, travel, clothing, and food.
Epstein gave the employee a $100,000 gift for her wedding in 2013 and a separate $250,000 payment in 2018, years after she had left his employment.
The employee's salary was reduced from over $100,000 to $75,000 when Epstein went to jail, and she left her job upon marrying in 2013.
